qa_pairs.question: Where is the hypodense nodule located?
qa_pairs.answer: In the right thyroid lobe.

qa_pairs.question: What is the laterality of the parenchymal fibrosis areas causing structural distortion?
qa_pairs.answer: In both lungs.

qa_pairs.question: What is the vertical position of the lymph nodes in relation to the trachea?
qa_pairs.answer: In the upper-lower paratracheal area.

qa_pairs.question: Where are the subcapsular parenchymal calcifications located in the liver?
qa_pairs.answer: In the posterior right lobe of the liver.

qa_pairs.question: What is the laterality of the traction bronchiectasis observed?
qa_pairs.answer: In both lungs.

qa_pairs.question: What is the spatial extent of the pleural thickening-effusion?
qa_pairs.answer: Bilateral pleural thickening-effusion was not detected.

qa_pairs.question: What is the position of the calcific atherosclerotic changes?
qa_pairs.answer: In the thoracic aorta and coronary artery walls.

qa_pairs.question: Where are the multiple lymph nodes observed?
qa_pairs.answer: In the mediastinal, upper-lower paratracheal, aorticopulmonary window, prevascular area, and subcarinal area.

qa_pairs.question: What is the vertical position of the thoracic esophagus calibration?
qa_pairs.answer: Normal, with no significant pathological wall thickening detected.

qa_pairs.question: What is the laterality of the peribronchial thickenings observed?
qa_pairs.answer: In both lungs.

qa_pairs.question: Where was the largest parenchymal nodule located in the lungs?
qa_pairs.answer: In the upper lobe of the right lung.

qa_pairs.question: What was observed in the center of both lungs?
qa_pairs.answer: Minimal peribronchial thickening.

qa_pairs.question: Where were the pleuroparenchymal sequelae density increases observed?
qa_pairs.answer: In the middle lobe of the right lung and the inferior lingular segment of the left lung.

qa_pairs.question: Where were bulla formations observed in the lungs?
qa_pairs.answer: In both lungs apical.

qa_pairs.question: Where was a simple cyst observed in the kidneys?
qa_pairs.answer: In the upper pole of the left kidney.

qa_pairs.question: What was the condition of the bilateral adrenal gland calibration?
qa_pairs.answer: Normal.

qa_pairs.question: Were any lymph nodes detected in the mediastinal and bilateral hilar regions?
qa_pairs.answer: No lymph node was detected in pathological size and appearance.

qa_pairs.question: What was the condition of the trachea and lumen of both main bronchi?
qa_pairs.answer: They are open with no occlusive pathology detected.

qa_pairs.question: Where is the trachea located in relation to the midline?
qa_pairs.answer: The trachea is in the midline.

qa_pairs.question: Which side of the diaphragm is elevated?
qa_pairs.answer: The left hemidiaphragm is elevated.

qa_pairs.question: Where are the bulla formations located in the lungs?
qa_pairs.answer: Bulla formations are located at the apex of both lungs.

qa_pairs.question: In which segments of the lungs were pleuroparenchymal sequelae density increases observed?
qa_pairs.answer: Pleuroparenchymal sequelae density increases were observed in the right lung middle lobe, left lung upper lobe inferior lingular, and left lung lower lobe basal segment.

qa_pairs.question: Where is the simple cortical cyst located in the kidney?
qa_pairs.answer: The simple cortical cyst is located in the upper pole of the left kidney.

qa_pairs.question: What is the location of the minimal peribronchial thickening observed in the lungs?
qa_pairs.answer: Minimal peribronchial thickening was observed in the center of both lungs.

qa_pairs.question: Are there any enlarged lymph nodes detected in the prevascular or pre-paratracheal regions?
qa_pairs.answer: No enlarged lymph nodes were detected in the prevascular or pre-paratracheal regions.

qa_pairs.question: What is the condition of the bilateral adrenal gland calibration?
qa_pairs.answer: Bilateral adrenal gland calibration was normal.

qa_pairs.question: Is there any mass lesion or active infiltration detected in the lungs?
qa_pairs.answer: No mass lesion or active infiltration was detected in both lungs.

qa_pairs.question: Where is the mass located in the right lung?
qa_pairs.answer: In the thickest part of the right lung, completely surrounding the pleura at its apex.

qa_pairs.question: What is the vertical position of the reticular density increase in the right lung?
qa_pairs.answer: In the upper lobe of the right lung.

qa_pairs.question: Where are the effusion areas located?
qa_pairs.answer: Between the pleural leaves on the right.

qa_pairs.question: What is the location of the consolidation area with air bronchograms?
qa_pairs.answer: In the middle lobe of the right lung.

qa_pairs.question: Where are the soft tissue densities with central necrotic appearance found?
qa_pairs.answer: In the lower paratracheal area.

qa_pairs.question: Which side of the lung shows parenchymal fibrosis and bulla formation?
qa_pairs.answer: In the upper lobe of the left lung.

qa_pairs.question: Where are the millimetric parenchymal nodules observed?
qa_pairs.answer: In the upper and lower lobes of the left lung.

qa_pairs.question: What is the size and location of the parenchymal nodule in the right lung?
qa_pairs.answer: A 5 mm diameter parenchymal nodule in the middle lobe of the right lung.

qa_pairs.question: Where are the lymphadenopathies located in relation to the celiac and superior mesenteric arteries?
qa_pairs.answer: At the level of the celiac and superior mesenteric arteries.

qa_pairs.question: What is the spatial relationship of the malignant mass in the right lung?
qa_pairs.answer: Surrounding the pleura in the apical region of the upper lobe of the right lung.

qa_pairs.question: Where are the lymph nodes measuring 19x11 mm located?
qa_pairs.answer: The lymph nodes are located in the upper-lower paratracheal, prevascular, precarinal, and subcarinal localizations.

qa_pairs.question: In which area of the lungs are the patchy areas of consolidation extending to the periphery observed?
qa_pairs.answer: The patchy areas of consolidation extending to the periphery are observed in the perihilar area of both lungs.

qa_pairs.question: What is the thickness of the free fluid observed between the pleural leaves on the right side?
qa_pairs.answer: The thickness of the free fluid observed between the pleural leaves on the right side is 24 mm.

qa_pairs.question: What is the thickness of the free fluid observed between the pleural leaves on the left side?
qa_pairs.answer: The thickness of the free fluid observed between the pleural leaves on the left side is 5 mm.

qa_pairs.question: Where are the smooth interseptal thickenings most prominent?
qa_pairs.answer: The smooth interseptal thickenings are most prominent in the lower lobes of both lungs.

qa_pairs.question: Where is the prosthetic material observed?
qa_pairs.answer: The prosthetic material is observed in the aortic valve.

qa_pairs.question: Where is the post-op suture material located?
qa_pairs.answer: The post-op suture material is located on the wall of the ascending aorta.

qa_pairs.question: Where are the metallic suture materials of sternotomy observed?
qa_pairs.answer: The metallic suture materials of sternotomy are observed in the sternum.

qa_pairs.question: Where are the minimal bronchiectasis located in the lungs?
qa_pairs.answer: At the central level in both lungs.

qa_pairs.question: What is the laterality of the bronchiectasis observed in the lungs?
qa_pairs.answer: Bilateral.

qa_pairs.question: Where are the calcific plaques observed?
qa_pairs.answer: In the coronary arteries.

qa_pairs.question: What is the vertical position of the osteophytes observed in the vertebrae?
qa_pairs.answer: In the thoracic vertebrae.

qa_pairs.question: Where are the millimetric stones observed?
qa_pairs.answer: In the gallbladder.

qa_pairs.question: What is the spatial relationship of the fibrotic densities to the lung parenchyma?
qa_pairs.answer: Adjacent to the lung parenchyma.

qa_pairs.question: Is there any pleural effusion or thickening detected in the scan?
qa_pairs.answer: No, pleural effusion or thickening was not detected.

qa_pairs.question: What is the condition of the thoracic esophagus as described in the report?
qa_pairs.answer: The thoracic esophagus calibration was normal with no significant tumoral wall thickening detected.

qa_pairs.question: Are there any enlarged lymph nodes detected in the prevascular, pre-paratracheal, subcarinal, or bilateral hilar-axillary regions?
qa_pairs.answer: No, enlarged lymph nodes in these regions were not detected.

qa_pairs.question: Where are the sequelae fibroatelectatic changes observed?
qa_pairs.answer: In the upper lobes of both lungs.

qa_pairs.question: On which side is the nodular ground glass density observed in the upper lobe apical segment?
qa_pairs.answer: On the right side, in the lateral subpleural region.

qa_pairs.question: Where are the two nonspecific millimetric pulmonary nodules located?
qa_pairs.answer: In the posterior segment of the right lung upper lobe.

qa_pairs.question: What type of changes are observed in both lungs?
qa_pairs.answer: Diffuse emphysematous changes.

qa_pairs.question: Where are the sclerotic changes observed?
qa_pairs.answer: In the lower cervical vertebral corpuscles.

qa_pairs.question: Are there any enlarged lymph nodes detected in the prevascular or pre-paratracheal regions?
qa_pairs.answer: No enlarged lymph nodes were detected in the prevascular or pre-paratracheal regions.

qa_pairs.question: What is the condition of the bilateral adrenal glands?
qa_pairs.answer: The bilateral adrenal glands were normal and no space-occupying lesion was detected.

qa_pairs.question: Where are osteophytic taperings observed?
qa_pairs.answer: In the thoracic vertebrae.

qa_pairs.question: Is there any space-occupying lesion detected in the liver?
qa_pairs.answer: No space-occupying lesion was detected in the liver.

qa_pairs.question: Where are the atheroma plaques located in the coronary artery?
qa_pairs.answer: In the left coronary artery.

qa_pairs.question: Which regions contain lymphadenopathies according to the report?
qa_pairs.answer: The prevascular region, paratracheal region, and subcarinal region.

qa_pairs.question: Where is the endobronchial mass located in the lung?
qa_pairs.answer: In the left lung upper lobe lingular segment bronchus.

qa_pairs.question: In which direction does the endobronchial mass extend?
qa_pairs.answer: Towards the superior and inferior subsegment bronchi.

qa_pairs.question: Where is the irregularly circumscribed nodule located in the lung?
qa_pairs.answer: In the posterior part of the left lung upper lobe lingular segment.

qa_pairs.question: Which lung lobe shows budding tree appearances?
qa_pairs.answer: The left lung upper lobe lingular segment.

qa_pairs.question: Where is the mass located in the adrenal glands?
qa_pairs.answer: In the left adrenal gland.

qa_pairs.question: What is observed in the bladder wall according to the report?
qa_pairs.answer: A diffuse thickness increase is observed in the bladder wall.

qa_pairs.answer: In the left coronary artery.

qa_pairs.answer: The prevascular region, paratracheal region, and subcarinal region.

qa_pairs.question: Where is the endobronchial mass located in the lung?
qa_pairs.answer: In the left lung upper lobe lingular segment bronchus.

qa_pairs.question: In which direction does the endobronchial mass extend?
qa_pairs.answer: Towards the superior and inferior subsegment bronchi.

qa_pairs.question: Where is the irregularly circumscribed nodule located in the lung?
qa_pairs.answer: In the posterior part of the left lung upper lobe lingular segment.

qa_pairs.question: Which adrenal gland contains a mass, and what is its size?
qa_pairs.answer: The left adrenal gland contains a mass measuring approximately 52x70 mm.

qa_pairs.answer: A diffuse thickness increase is observed in the bladder wall.

qa_pairs.answer: Yes, there are several millimetric nonspecific nodules in both lungs.

qa_pairs.answer: The right adrenal gland is normal.

qa_pairs.answer: In the left lung upper lobe lingular segment.

qa_pairs.answer: In the left coronary artery.

qa_pairs.answer: The prevascular region, paratracheal region, and subcarinal region.

qa_pairs.answer: In the left lung upper lobe lingular segment bronchus.

qa_pairs.answer: It extends towards the superior and inferior subsegment bronchi.

qa_pairs.answer: In the posterior part of the left lung upper lobe lingular segment.

qa_pairs.answer: The left adrenal gland contains a mass measuring approximately 52x70 mm.

qa_pairs.answer: There is a diffuse thickness increase in the bladder wall.

qa_pairs.answer: Yes, there are several millimetric nonspecific nodules in both lungs.

qa_pairs.answer: The neural foramina are open.

qa_pairs.answer: In the abdominal aorta and iliac arteries.
